diff_hunk:
@@ -1960,11 +1960,7 @@ def pairwise_distance(x1, x2, p=2, eps=1e-6):
         >>> output = F.pairwise_distance(input1, input2, p=2)
         >>> output.backward()
     """
-    assert x1.size() == x2.size(), "Input sizes must be equal."
-    assert x1.dim() == 2, "Input must be a 2D matrix."
-    diff = torch.abs(x1 - x2)
-    out = torch.pow(diff + eps, p).sum(dim=1, keepdim=True)
body:
The reason I did this was because legacy seems to return (N) size. https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/legacy/nn/PairwiseDistance.py#L30

I'm not sure why the change was made, but I think we should make them the same. (By changing legacy behavior to (N, 1) maybe?)

body_text:
The reason I did this was because legacy seems to return (N) size. https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/legacy/nn/PairwiseDistance.py#L30
I'm not sure why the change was made, but I think we should make them the same. (By changing legacy behavior to (N, 1) maybe?)
